name: Network Fault Severity Analytical App
description: This app enables business users to identify target groups of customers based on their purchase patterns. Network Fault Severity Analytical App

appStages.name: Introduction
appStages.stageDetails:
{ "components": [ { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "

Network Fault Severity Analysis

Overview

This app aims to improve network reliability and performance in telecommunications infrastructure. It focuses on detecting and addressing network faults promptly to minimize service disruptions and enhance customer satisfaction.

Input

Users provide:

  • + Feature filters for severity type of the fault, resources affected and the event causing the failure recorded in the data
  • + Selection of features to be included during model training
  • + A custom dataset (see schema below) to run the trained model predictions on for validation

Output

The app delivers:

  • + Exploratory Data Analysis of the provided data, including various meaningful visualizations
  • + Network fault severity prediction for uploaded data (0-low to 1-critical)

Benefits

  • + Enables proactive identification of severe faults helps reduce service interruptions.
  • + Pinpoints critical areas, allowing for efficient deployment of maintenance teams and resources.
  • + Provides insights into fault patterns and root causes to inform strategic network improvements.

Data Description

Field Name Description
id A unique identifier for each fault record in the dataset.
location The geographical location where the fault occurred (e.g., "location 118").
severity_type The severity classification of the fault (e.g., "Major", "Minor", "Critical").
resource_type The type of resource affected by the fault (e.g., "Base Station", "Power Distribution Unit").
log_feature A feature identifier associated with the fault (e.g., "feature 312").
volume A numerical value representing the volume or magnitude of the fault.
event_type The type of event or fault that occurred (e.g., "Network card failure", "Copper cable damage").
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html", "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "HTML", "attrs": [ { "attr": "", "value": "" } ], "content": "
", "refreshOnChange": false, "key": "html2", "type": "htmlelement", "input": false, "tableView": false }, { "label": "Columns", "columns": [ { "components": [], "width": 6, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "size": "md", "currentWidth": 6 }, { "components": [ { "label": "Next", "action": "event", "showValidations": false, "theme": "info", "customClass": "float-right rounded", "tableView": false, "key": "getStarted", "type": "button", "event": "next", "input": true } ], "width": 6, "offset": 0, "push": 0, "pull": 0, "size": "md", "currentWidth": 6 } ], "key": "columns", "type": "columns", "input": false, "tableView": false } ] }

Train-Network-Fault-Severity-Prediction-Model
Fault-Severity-Prediction
